title: enlistment all young people

content: Ok, I'll bite... While I agree that they should, I don't think that it should be mandatory. That goes against what a free nation stands for. But, it sure does make one mature much faster. And, you tend to not sweat the little things once you get back in the private sector. One thing though, you need a little help with your English. "Enlist all young people" should be your header. Or, "All young people should enlist". And, the body should read "All young people should enlist in the military". Don't forget to use proper capitalization, Private.

content: Yeah, I went to a private profile about a year ago. Figured I had been around long enough to know the regulars and didn't feel the need to let the non-regulars know me. But, in case you want to know, I was a Sonar Tech (0415 ITASS, 9527 2M) on the John Paul Jones and then did a SeaSwap to the Higgins. Served 2002-2006. Have GWOT, GWOT-E, Sea Service(2), ESWS (plus the regular stuff, NDR, Pistol/rifle Expert, etc). Oh, and my name is Joe.

content: While at my civilian job, I heard a couple of 20+ yr olds talking about how they're kicking ass on some online combat video game,and how cool it was do certain things in the game.I came up and asked them,Why don't you join and do it for real? Thier response was "because you can't hit the reset button if your killed". I just shook my head as I walked away.This appears to be the typical attitude today,wanna be's that don't really wanna be,because it involves commitment and disipline,not to mention-holy ****! They might actually learn something not taught outside!

content: I disagree with mandatory military service basically as navy says but I do strongly advocate a period of Mandatory National Service for virtually every 18 yo. I know, we've debated and discussed this a number of times but it needs to be addressed till it catches on. 10tenths: "...mandatory. That goes against what a free nation stands for" And 10, everything in a "free nation" just ain't free. And citizens of this "free" nation already have a few obligations, mandatory service will be just another reasonable, mutually beneficial one of those. What my nation used to stand for deserved, if not required, more from every citizen than just voting and paying taxes. That "more" requirement has been deleted and look where we are for it.
reply: I disagree with mandatory military service basically as navy says but I do strongly advocate a period of Mandatory National Service for virtually every 18 yo.
